column4: ﻿sound is not working on my system (jaunty). it used to work, and still does on windows vista, to which i dual boot. here are the outputs of alsamixer and pavucontrol (both of them give errors): http://paste.ubuntu.com/345356/
is pulseaudio running?
try killing it, then restarting it with "start-pulseaudio-x11" and see what happens?
i've tried  this: ﻿killall pulseaudio; rm -rf ~/.pulse*    then press alt+f2  and type    pulseaudio   and press enter
that doesnt help. shud i try what u just saud?
dont do it in alt+f2. you dont get the errors then
try pulseaudio -vvv
pulseaudio -vvv -D
: ﻿pulseaudio -vvv -D gives "command not found", but i had killed pulseaudio from the system monitor, and it reappeared!
it autospawns when you start a audio-using app
i didnt get what you meant. could you explain it to me?
pulseaudio respawned because it starts automatically if anything tries to use the sound ard
okay, but what should i do now?
im not sure, sorry. was trying to get a log from pulseaudio, but command not found..
why would that be? if pulseaudio is installed, why should it say "not found"?
dunno. if its running its obviously ther. did you make a typo?
pulseaudio -vvv -D gives command not found, but pulseaudio gives this output:http://paste.ubuntu.com/345371/
that one just said its not startng becuse its already running
so the flags are resulting in the "command not found"?
i guess, though thats a bit weird. i dont know whats going on, sorry.
maybe try waiting around in #ubuntu-audio-help if you cant get help from anyone else here
ok thanks a lot anyway
